topic.title: Controlling the Text Direction Using the Unicode Direction Formatting Codes

body.p: These Unicode Direction Formatting Codes codes can be embedded in the edited text, specifying a text direction and embedding. However, it is not recommended to use them in XML as they are zero width characters, making it hard to debug the text arrangement.

row.entry: Treats the following text as embedded left-to-right.
Treats the following text as embedded right to left.
Forces the following characters to be treated as strong left-to-right characters.
Forces the following characters to be treated as strong right-to-left characters.
Restores the bidirectional state to what it was before the last LRE, RLE, RLO, or LRO.

body.p: To insert Unicode Direction Formatting Codes, use the Symbols toolbar actionCharacter Map dialog. To easily find such a code, you can either enter directly the hexadecimal value, or use the Details tab to enter the codes name.
offers the support for bi-directional text in all the side views (Outline view, Attributes view and so on) and text fields.
